title: This is how mage/ap mid vs ad mids has been addressed?
body:
So for a very long time, many mage/AP mid players have struggled with the fact that AD champs had the option to use Maw of Malmortius (Hexdrinker) and Mercurial Scimitar while AP champs only had Zhonyas to help in their mid lane match up. This has been complained about time and time again with no address from Riot. With Maw, they become fairly tanky (with both the resist and the shield) against AP and with Merc Scim, they became immune to crowd control effects, which almost mages have and rely on to reliably dish out their damage.

Now, not only do they **NOT** help the ap mids/mages (and other ap champs that go against ad; rumble and heimer in the top lane for example), but Riot also gives AD users yet ANOTHER item which helps further turns the tides in AD champ's favor.

Edge of Night (New)           
 Stats:
+60 Attack Damage
+35 Magic Resist

Maw of Malmortius
Stats:
Attack Damage lowered to 50 from 55
Magic resist **increased** to 45 from 40
[ADDED] Lifegrip now grants +20 Attack Damage (on top of what was previously there for this passive; life steal & spell vamp)

Mercurial Scimitar (No changes)
 Stats:
+35 magic resistance
+65 attack damage
+10% life steal
UNIQUE – QUICKSILVER: Removes all crowd control debuffs from your champion and grants +50% movement speed for 1 second. 90 second cooldown.

Combined, these items give 115 MR **AND** 175 AD. Jesus Christ, good luck as AP winning any fights after these 3 items have been built, if you're not already ahead. What's even worse, remember how earlier I mentioned that many mages rely on some sort of CC to safely dish out some of their damage? Well hell, now they have a free spell shield with an incredibly short cool down for such a powerful tool.(I understand that these are PBE values, not live; but how could these even make it into the PBE?) Active of Edge of Night (EoN):

**UNIQUE Active** - Night's Veil: Channel for 1.5 seconds to grant a spell shield that blocks the next enemy ability. Lasts for 10 seconds. (30 second cooldown) (Can move while channeling)
 
They refuse to allow Quick silver sash to build into any AP item because they thought Zhonya's + QSS active would be too strong. **Now all AD champs can walk around with not only an CC remover but ALSO a spell shield.** How in anyway is this fair?

Now before you say, AP mids/mages have other options that don't include armor but still help them, such as Rylai's, the hextech items(minus gunblade), etc., I would like to remind you that there are clashes between champ skills and these item's passives that render the item cost inefficient. How? Take Lux for example, she does not benefit from rylais at all except for her ult really. Her q is a root, which roots for the duration of the slow, her E is a slow in itself so the additionally slow is partially ineffective. As for proto belt, why would lux use that item, if you're using it to  retreat, you are not using the damage, and as a mage, why would protobelt's active used to get closer to your enemy? And as for GLP-800, lets be honest; how often do you even see this item built? Simply put, the item is lack luster and underwhelming. 
Don't believe only a few champions actually build it?   http://www.lolking.net/items/3030#topchampions    A sol with about 1/3rd of the time it being built is the most using champ of the item. Rod of Ages is only effective and cost efficient on champs with mana so it inconveniences many ap mids/tops (Katarina, Vlad, Rumble, Akali, Morde, Kennen, etc) . Banner of Command is being changed so that it gives no AP anymore.

I guess you can say they still have Liandry's Torment, but if that's the case, you can also include AD/HP items which they also have a plethora of, such The Black Cleaver, Frozen Mallet, Titanic Hydra (if melee), Sterak's and TriForce (which I must add isnt used on champs lacking mana, although *cough* yasuo *cough*).

TL;DR : This new item, Edge of Night, makes laning as an AP champ against an AD even more of a nightmare than it already was. And the passives/actives of these items stacking with each other will make trying to take them down even more hellish.

So what? It's not like Riot thinks about which AD champs might abuse their insane variety of items. The past year has been one abuse case after another, from immortal Sterak's Graves to assassin ADCs to Maw/Sterak's stacking giving every AD passive immunity to AP burst.

Like, think about it. You have fractions of a second to react to engages from Ev, Shaco, Hec, Noc. It's already pretty rare to survive their ganks if you're squishy because they just appear on top of you out of nowhere. Like, if a Mastery Yi ults you with that Edge shield + Alpha and Meditate, there's absolutely nothing a caster can do. Literally zero counterplay.

But in general, why does Riot think it's necessary to remove counterplay from so many AD champs that are already far harder to play against than play as? We can't counter invisibility anymore. We have to juke multiple shields and land skillshots just to peel a 1v1. We can't burst vs Maw. And we can't even ward against Duskblade. It's fucking unbelievable.
They wont even give us {{item:3170}}. At this point id even accept if Zhonyas was removed if it meant more options

But zhonya's hourglass also makes you immune to cc. and damage.

Mages have a mana pool and when you PICK A MAGE, your objective is to OUT RANGE your opponent. You don't pick a mage to OUT DUEL them in lane or whatever. You CAN but the ways of doing so will be risky and resource consuming. The problem with mages is their last hitting potential if they are being forced to solo lane against an AD lane bruiser. Towers can way too easily deny a couple kills of farm if you are not playing passive -- as you are forced to in certain matchups, if not all, without a lead. And since they build AD, they can out push the next wave before it reaches your inner tower. 

AD just scales really hard in this game. But MR scales much less. by building hexdrinker and scimitar you are sacrificing a big portion of your damage scaling onto one source of defense, pure MR/magic shield. It's a bad idea but it pays off opportunistically, which arise to occasion more often the more chances you get through lane while being even or ahead. Mages just wave clear and shit, throw stuff from the back. By picking an APC mid you are saying "I will win this lane or I will lose the game because I will die instantly later and do nothing useful".

Zhonya also ccs you and is only up every second fight. I wish they would just remove this dumb active and give this item a normal amount of stats and a some nice passive/active that nobody cares about.

Also your range argument is completely invalid for almost every ap melee like fizz, ekko, diana, kassadin, katarina, (rumble), evelynn, akali, (elise). Those champions fulfill almost exactly the same role as their ad counterparts and those items are just a big middle finger to all of them. It was already really annoying to basically auto-loose your lane because your opponent finished hexdrinker/maw, which is already far superior to seekers/zhonyas in every aspect and now they have even a 2. item to **** you even more than they already did.
And instead of adding items that helps ap melee to do thier job, they keep nerfing ap items because of some bullshit utility nobody cared about. Soon even rylais, the last good ap-def item, will be gone because riot probably decides to nerf the ap/hp instead of removing the stupid slow. Even protobelt will get a nerf to its damage and will become a dead item because the slot/gold efficiency is not worth the active.

Agreed; the hourglass is too frustrating on champions who already have safety (ekko, fizz, ext) and about useless on any immobile mage (syndra, velkoz, ext) as they'll still be in danger when it ends. However I don't regarding the crystal scepter, as it was pretty much the only way said immobile mages could catch the hyper mobile champions that were are still are popular. But I doubt the protobelt will be forgotten given that it has a low cooldown (for an active item) dash, making some champions even more troublesome to deal with.
